api/Spine.Unity.WaitForSpineAnimationCom.title: Class WaitForSpineAnimationComplete | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.Unity.WaitForSpineAnimationCom.keywords: Class WaitForSpineAnimationComplete Use this as a condition-blocking yield instruction for Unity Coroutines. The routine will pause until the AnimationState.TrackEntry fires its Complete event. It can be configured to trigger on the End event as well to cover interruption. See the Spine Unity Events documentation page and for more information on when track events will be triggered. api/Spine.Unity.WaitForSpineAnimation.ht.keywords: Class WaitForSpineAnimation Use this as a condition-blocking yield instruction for Unity Coroutines. The routine will pause until the AnimationState.TrackEntry fires any of the configured events. See the Spine Unity Events documentation page and for more information on when track events will be triggered. api/Spine.html.title: Namespace Spine | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.html.keywords: Namespace Spine Classes Animation A simple container for a list of timelines and a name. AnimationState Applies animations over time, queues animations for later playback, mixes (crossfading) between animations, and applies multiple animations on top of each other (layering). See Applying Animations in the Spine Runtimes Guide. AnimationStateData Stores mix (crossfade) durations to be applied when AnimationState animations are changed. AnimationStateData.AnimationPairComparer Atlas AtlasAttachmentLoader An AttachmentLoader that configures attachments using texture regions from an Atlas. See Loading Skeleton Data in the Spine Runtimes Guide. AtlasPage AtlasRegion Attachment AttachmentTimeline Changes a slot's Attachment . Bone Stores a bone's current pose. A bone has a local transform which is used to compute its world transform. A bone also has an applied transform, which is a local transform that can be applied to compute the world transform. The local transform and applied transform may differ if a constraint or application code modifies the world transform after it was computed from the local transform. BoneData BoundingBoxAttachment Attachment that has a polygon for bounds checking. ClippingAttachment ColorTimeline Changes a slot's . ConstraintData The base class for all constraint datas. CurveTimeline The base class for timelines that use interpolation between key frame values. DeformTimeline Changes a slot's Deform to deform a VertexAttachment . DrawOrderTimeline Changes a skeleton's DrawOrder . Event Stores the current pose values for an Event. EventData Stores the setup pose values for an Event. EventTimeline Fires an Event when specific animation times are reached. ExposedList<T> IInterpolation IkConstraint Stores the current pose for an IK constraint. An IK constraint adjusts the rotation of 1 or 2 constrained bones so the tip of the last bone is as close to the target bone as possible. See IK constraints in the Spine User Guide. IkConstraintData Stores the setup pose for an IkConstraint. IkConstraintTimeline Changes an IK constraint's Mix , Softness , BendDirection , Stretch , and Compress . Json MathUtils MeshAttachment Attachment that displays a texture region using a mesh. PathAttachment PathConstraint Stores the current pose for a path constraint. A path constraint adjusts the rotation, translation, and scale of the constrained bones so they follow a {@link PathAttachment}. See Path constraints in the Spine User Guide. PathConstraintData PathConstraintMixTimeline Changes a path constraint's mixes. PathConstraintPositionTimeline Changes a path constraint's Position . PathConstraintSpacingTimeline Changes a path constraint's Spacing . PointAttachment Polygon Pool<T> Pow PowOut RegionAttachment Attachment that displays a texture region. RotateTimeline Changes a bone's local Rotation . ScaleTimeline ShearTimeline Changes a bone's local ShearX and ShearY . Skeleton SkeletonBinary SkeletonBounds Collects each BoundingBoxAttachment that is visible and computes the world vertices for its polygon. The polygon vertices are provided along with convenience methods for doing hit detection. SkeletonClipping SkeletonData Stores the setup pose and all of the stateless data for a skeleton. SkeletonExtensions SkeletonJson Skin Stores attachments by slot index and attachment name. See SkeletonData DefaultSkin , Skeleton Skin , and Runtime skins in the Spine Runtimes Guide. Slot Stores a slot's current pose. Slots organize attachments for {@link Skeleton#drawOrder} purposes and provide a place to store state for an attachment.State cannot be stored in an attachment itself because attachments are stateless and may be shared across multiple skeletons. SlotData TrackEntry Stores settings and other state for the playback of an animation on an AnimationState track. References to a track entry must not be kept after the event occurs. TransformConstraint Stores the current pose for a transform constraint. A transform constraint adjusts the world transform of the constrained bones to match that of the target bone. See Transform constraints in the Spine User Guide. TransformConstraintData TransformConstraintTimeline Changes a transform constraint's mixes. TranslateTimeline Triangulator TwoColorTimeline Changes a slot's and for two color tinting. VertexAttachment An attachment with vertices that are transformed by one or more bones and can be deformed by a slot's Deform . Structs AnimationStateData.AnimationPair BoneMatrix ExposedList<T>.Enumerator Skin.SkinEntry Stores an entry in the skin consisting of the slot index, name, and attachment. Interfaces AttachmentLoader IBoneTimeline An interface for timelines which change the property of a bone. IHasRendererObject ISlotTimeline An interface for timelines which change the property of a slot. IUpdatable The interface for items updated by UpdateWorldTransform() . Pool<T>.IPoolable TextureLoader Timeline The interface for all timelines. Enums AttachmentType BlendMode Format MixBlend Controls how a timeline is mixed with the setup or current pose. MixDirection Indicates whether a timeline's alpha is mixing out over time toward 0 (the setup or current pose value) or mixing in toward 1 (the timeline's value). PositionMode RotateMode SpacingMode TextureFilter TextureWrap TransformMode Delegates AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate AnimationState.TrackEntryEventDelegate

api/Spine.Unity.Editor.SkeletonBaker.htm.title: Class SkeletonBaker | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.Unity.Editor.SkeletonBaker.htm.keywords: Class SkeletonBaker [SUPPORTS] Linear, Constant, and Bezier Curves* Inverse Kinematics* Inherit Rotation Translate Timeline Rotate Timeline Scale Timeline** Event Timeline*** Attachment Timeline RegionAttachment MeshAttachment (optionally Skinned) [LIMITATIONS] *Bezier Curves are baked into the animation at 60fps and are not realtime. Use bakeIncrement constant to adjust key density if desired. *Inverse Kinematics is baked into the animation at 60fps and are not realtime. Use bakeIncrement constant to adjust key density if desired. ***Events may only fire 1 type of data per event in Unity safely so priority to String data if present in Spine key, otherwise a Float is sent whether the Spine key was Int or Float with priority given to Int. [DOES NOT SUPPORT] FFD (Unity does not provide access to BlendShapes with code) Color Keys (Maybe one day when Unity supports full FBX standard and provides access with code) Draw Order Keyframes Inheritance Object SkeletonBaker Inherited Members Object.Equals(Object) Object.Equals(Object, Object) Object.GetHashCode() Object.GetType() Object.MemberwiseClone() Object.ReferenceEquals(Object, Object) Object.ToString() Namespace : Spine.Unity.Editor Assembly : spine-unity-editor.dll Syntax public static class SkeletonBaker Methods | Improve this Doc View Source BakeRegion(SpineAtlasAsset, AtlasRegion, Boolean) Declaration public static GameObject BakeRegion(SpineAtlasAsset atlasAsset, AtlasRegion region, bool autoSave = true) Parameters Type Name Description SpineAtlasAsset atlasAsset AtlasRegion region Boolean autoSave Returns Type Description UnityEngine.GameObject | Improve this Doc View Source BakeToPrefab(SkeletonDataAsset, ExposedList<Skin>, String, Boolean, Boolean, SendMessageOptions) Declaration public static void BakeToPrefab(SkeletonDataAsset skeletonDataAsset, ExposedList<Skin> skins, string outputPath = "", bool bakeAnimations = true, bool bakeIK = true, SendMessageOptions eventOptions = SendMessageOptions.DontRequireReceiver) Parameters Type Name Description SkeletonDataAsset skeletonDataAsset ExposedList < Skin > skins String outputPath Boolean bakeAnimations Boolean bakeIK UnityEngine.SendMessageOptions eventOptions | Improve this Doc View Source GenerateMecanimAnimationClips(SkeletonDataAsset) Declaration public static void GenerateMecanimAnimationClips(SkeletonDataAsset skeletonDataAsset) Parameters Type Name Description SkeletonDataAsset skeletonDataAsset | Improve this Doc View Source UpdateMecanimClips(SkeletonDataAsset) Declaration public static void UpdateMecanimClips(SkeletonDataAsset skeletonDataAsset) Parameters Type Name Description SkeletonDataAsset skeletonDataAsset

If the slot's Deform is not empty, it is used to deform the vertices. See World transforms in the Spine Runtimes Guide. Declaration public void ComputeWorldVertices(Slot slot, int start, int count, float[] worldVertices, int offset, int stride = 2) Parameters Type Name Description Slot slot Int32 start The index of the first Vertices value to transform. Each vertex has 2 values, x and y. Int32 count The number of world vertex values to output. Must be less than or equal to WorldVerticesLength - start. Single [] worldVertices The output world vertices. Must have a length greater than or equal to offset + count . Int32 offset The worldVertices index to begin writing values. Int32 stride The number of worldVertices entries between the value pairs written. | Improve this Doc View Source ComputeWorldVertices(Slot, Single[]) Declaration public void ComputeWorldVertices(Slot slot, float[] worldVertices) Parameters Type Name Description Slot slot Single [] worldVertices Extension Methods SkeletonExtensions.IsWeighted(VertexAttachment) SkeletonExtensions.IsRenderable(Attachment) SkeletonExtensions.GetMaterial(Attachment) SkeletonExtensions.GetLocalVertices(VertexAttachment, Slot, Vector2[]) SkeletonExtensions.GetWorldVertices(VertexAttachment, Slot, Vector2[]) AttachmentCloneExtensions.GetCopy(Attachment, Boolean) AttachmentCloneExtensions.GetRemappedClone(Attachment, Sprite, Material, Boolean, Boolean, Boolean) AttachmentCloneExtensions.GetRemappedClone(Attachment, AtlasRegion, Boolean, Boolean, Single) AttachmentRegionExtensions.GetRegion(Attachment) AttachmentRegionExtensions.SetRegion(Attachment, AtlasRegion, Boolean)

api/Spine.Unity.WaitForSpineAnimationEnd.title: Class WaitForSpineAnimationEnd | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.Unity.WaitForSpineAnimationEnd.keywords: Class WaitForSpineAnimationEnd Use this as a condition-blocking yield instruction for Unity Coroutines. The routine will pause until the AnimationState.TrackEntry fires its End event. See the Spine Unity Events documentation page and for more information on when track events will be triggered. [HelpURL("http://esotericsoftware.com/spine-unity-rendering")] public class SkeletonRenderer : MonoBehaviour, ISkeletonComponent, IHasSkeletonDataAsset Fields | Improve this Doc View Source addNormals If true, the mesh generator adds normals to the output mesh. For better performance and reduced memory requirements, use a shader that assumes the desired normal. Declaration [FormerlySerializedAs("calculateNormals")] public bool addNormals Field Value Type Description Boolean | Improve this Doc View Source calculateTangents If true, tangents are calculated every frame and added to the Mesh. Enable this when using a shader that uses lighting that requires tangents. popup menu for Spine IK Constraints (Spine.IkConstraint) Declaration public SpineIkConstraint(string startsWith = "", string dataField = "", bool includeNone = true, bool fallbackToTextField = false) Parameters Type Name Description String startsWith Filters popup results to elements that begin with supplied string. String dataField If specified, a locally scoped field with the name supplied by in dataField will be used to fill the popup results. Valid types are SkeletonDataAsset and SkeletonRenderer (and derivatives). If left empty and the script the attribute is applied to is derived from Component, GetComponent(SkeletonRenderer)() will be called as a fallback. Boolean includeNone If true, the dropdown list will include a "none" option which stored as an empty string. Boolean fallbackToTextField If true, and an animation list source can't be found, the field will fall back to a normal text field. If false, it will show an error.

Type Description Point2DList.WindingOrderType | Improve this Doc View Source CheckPolygon() Checks if polygon is valid for use in Box2d engine. Last ditch effort to ensure no invalid polygons are added to world geometry. Performs a full check, for simplicity, convexity, orientation, minimum angle, and volume. This won't be very efficient, and a lot of it is redundant when other tools in this section are used. api/Spine.AnimationState.html.keywords: Class AnimationState Applies animations over time, queues animations for later playback, mixes (crossfading) between animations, and applies multiple animations on top of each other (layering). See Applying Animations in the Spine Runtimes Guide. Inheritance Object AnimationState Inherited Members Object.Equals(Object) Object.Equals(Object, Object) Object.GetHashCode() Object.GetType() Object.MemberwiseClone() Object.ReferenceEquals(Object, Object) Namespace : Spine Assembly : spine-unity.dll Syntax public class AnimationState Constructors | Improve this Doc View Source AnimationState(AnimationStateData) Declaration public AnimationState(AnimationStateData data) Parameters Type Name Description AnimationStateData data Fields | Improve this Doc View Source data Declaration protected AnimationStateData data Field Value Type Description AnimationStateData Properties | Improve this Doc View Source Data The AnimationStateData to look up mix durations. Declaration public AnimationStateData Data { get; set; } Property Value Type Description AnimationStateData | Improve this Doc View Source TimeScale Multiplier for the delta time when the animation state is updated, causing time for all animations and mixes to play slower or faster. Defaults to 1. See TrackEntry TimeScale for affecting a single animation. Declaration public float TimeScale { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source Tracks A list of tracks that have animations, which may contain nulls. Declaration public ExposedList<TrackEntry> Tracks { get; } Property Value Type Description ExposedList < TrackEntry > Methods | Improve this Doc View Source AddAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean, Single) Adds an animation to be played after the current or last queued animation for a track. If the track is empty, it is equivalent to calling SetAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean) . Declaration public TrackEntry AddAnimation(int trackIndex, Animation animation, bool loop, float delay) Parameters Type Name Description Int32 trackIndex Animation animation Boolean loop Single delay If > 0, sets Delay . If <= 0, the delay set is the duration of the previous track entry minus any mix duration (from the {@link AnimationStateData}) plus the specified Delay (ie the mix ends at ( Delay = 0) or before ( Delay < 0) the previous track entry duration). If the previous entry is looping, its next loop completion is used instead of its duration. Returns Type Description TrackEntry A track entry to allow further customization of animation playback. References to the track entry must not be kept after the Dispose event occurs. | Improve this Doc View Source AddAnimation(Int32, String, Boolean, Single) Queues an animation by name. Declaration public TrackEntry AddAnimation(int trackIndex, string animationName, bool loop, float delay) Parameters Type Name Description Int32 trackIndex String animationName Boolean loop Single delay Returns Type Description TrackEntry See Also AddAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean, Single) | Improve this Doc View Source AddEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single, Single) Adds an empty animation to be played after the current or last queued animation for a track, and sets the track entry's MixDuration . If the track is empty, it is equivalent to calling SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single) . Declaration public TrackEntry AddEmptyAnimation(int trackIndex, float mixDuration, float delay) Parameters Type Name Description Int32 trackIndex Track number. Single mixDuration Mix duration. Single delay If > 0, sets Delay . If <= 0, the delay set is the duration of the previous track entry minus any mix duration plus the specified Delay (ie the mix ends at ( Delay = 0) or before ( Delay < 0) the previous track entry duration). If the previous entry is looping, its next loop completion is used instead of its duration. Returns Type Description TrackEntry A track entry to allow further customization of animation playback. References to the track entry must not be kept after the Dispose event occurs. See Also SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single) | Improve this Doc View Source Apply(Skeleton) Poses the skeleton using the track entry animations. There are no side effects other than invoking listeners, so the animation state can be applied to multiple skeletons to pose them identically. Declaration public bool Apply(Skeleton skeleton) Parameters Type Name Description Skeleton skeleton Returns Type Description Boolean True if any animations were applied. | Improve this Doc View Source ClearListenerNotifications() Declaration public void ClearListenerNotifications() | Improve this Doc View Source ClearTrack(Int32) Removes all animations from the track, leaving skeletons in their current pose. It may be desired to use SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single) to mix the skeletons back to the setup pose, rather than leaving them in their current pose. Declaration public void ClearTrack(int trackIndex) Parameters Type Name Description Int32 trackIndex | Improve this Doc View Source ClearTracks() Removes all animations from all tracks, leaving skeletons in their current pose. It may be desired to use SetEmptyAnimations(Single) to mix the skeletons back to the setup pose, rather than leaving them in their current pose. Declaration public void ClearTracks() | Improve this Doc View Source GetCurrent(Int32) Declaration public TrackEntry GetCurrent(int trackIndex) Parameters Type Name Description Int32 trackIndex Returns Type Description TrackEntry The track entry for the animation currently playing on the track, or null if no animation is currently playing. | Improve this Doc View Source SetAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean) Sets the current animation for a track, discarding any queued animations. If the formerly current track entry was never applied to a skeleton, it is replaced (not mixed from). Declaration public TrackEntry SetAnimation(int trackIndex, Animation animation, bool loop) Parameters Type Name Description Int32 trackIndex Animation animation Boolean loop If true, the animation will repeat. If false it will not, instead its last frame is applied if played beyond its duration. In either case TrackEnd determines when the track is cleared. Returns Type Description TrackEntry A track entry to allow further customization of animation playback. References to the track entry must not be kept after the Dispose event occurs. | Improve this Doc View Source SetAnimation(Int32, String, Boolean) Sets an animation by name. SetAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean) Declaration public TrackEntry SetAnimation(int trackIndex, string animationName, bool loop) Parameters Type Name Description Int32 trackIndex String animationName Boolean loop Returns Type Description TrackEntry | Improve this Doc View Source SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single) Sets an empty animation for a track, discarding any queued animations, and sets the track entry's . An empty animation has no timelines and serves as a placeholder for mixing in or out. Mixing out is done by setting an empty animation with a mix duration using either SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single) , SetEmptyAnimations(Single) , or AddEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single, Single) . Mixing to an empty animation causes the previous animation to be applied less and less over the mix duration. Properties keyed in the previous animation transition to the value from lower tracks or to the setup pose value if no lower tracks key the property. A mix duration of 0 still mixes out over one frame. Mixing in is done by first setting an empty animation, then adding an animation using and on the returned track entry, set the . Mixing from an empty animation causes the new animation to be applied more and more over the mix duration. Properties keyed in the new animation transition from the value from lower tracks or from the setup pose value if no lower tracks key the property to the value keyed in the new animation. Declaration public TrackEntry SetEmptyAnimation(int trackIndex, float mixDuration) Parameters Type Name Description Int32 trackIndex Single mixDuration Returns Type Description TrackEntry | Improve this Doc View Source SetEmptyAnimations(Single) Sets an empty animation for every track, discarding any queued animations, and mixes to it over the specified mix duration. Declaration public void SetEmptyAnimations(float mixDuration) Parameters Type Name Description Single mixDuration | Improve this Doc View Source ToString() Declaration public override string ToString() Returns Type Description String Overrides Object.ToString() | Improve this Doc View Source Update(Single) Increments the track entry TrackTime , setting queued animations as current if needed. api/Spine.TrackEntry.html.title: Class TrackEntry | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.TrackEntry.html.keywords: Class TrackEntry Stores settings and other state for the playback of an animation on an AnimationState track. References to a track entry must not be kept after the event occurs. Inheritance Object TrackEntry Implements Pool.IPoolable <> Inherited Members Object.Equals(Object) Object.Equals(Object, Object) Object.GetHashCode() Object.GetType() Object.MemberwiseClone() Object.ReferenceEquals(Object, Object) Namespace : Spine Assembly : spine-unity.dll Syntax public class TrackEntry : Pool<TrackEntry>.IPoolable Properties | Improve this Doc View Source Alpha Declaration public float Alpha { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source Animation The animation to apply for this track entry. Declaration public Animation Animation { get; } Property Value Type Description Animation | Improve this Doc View Source AnimationEnd Seconds for the last frame of this animation. Non-looping animations won't play past this time. Looping animations will loop back to AnimationStart at this time. Defaults to the animation Duration . Declaration public float AnimationEnd { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source AnimationLast The time in seconds this animation was last applied. Some timelines use this for one-time triggers. Eg, when this animation is applied, event timelines will fire all events between the AnimationLast time (exclusive) and AnimationTime (inclusive). Defaults to -1 to ensure triggers on frame 0 happen the first time this animation is applied. Declaration public float AnimationLast { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source AnimationStart Declaration public float AnimationStart { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source AnimationTime Uses TrackTime to compute the AnimationTime , which is between AnimationStart and AnimationEnd . When the TrackTime is 0, the AnimationTime is equal to the AnimationStart time. Declaration public float AnimationTime { get; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source AttachmentThreshold When the mix percentage ( MixTime / MixDuration ) is less than the AttachmentThreshold , attachment timelines are applied while this animation is being mixed out. Defaults to 0, so attachment timelines are not applied while this animation is being mixed out. Declaration public float AttachmentThreshold { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source Delay Seconds to postpone playing the animation. When this track entry is the current track entry, Delay postpones incrementing the TrackTime . When this track entry is queued, Delay is the time from the start of the previous animation to when this track entry will become the current track entry (ie when the previous track entry TrackTime >= this track entry's Delay ). TimeScale affects the delay. Declaration public float Delay { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source DrawOrderThreshold When the mix percentage ( MixTime / MixDuration ) is less than the DrawOrderThreshold , draw order timelines are applied while this animation is being mixed out. Defaults to 0, so draw order timelines are not applied while this animation is being mixed out. Declaration public float DrawOrderThreshold { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source EventThreshold When the mix percentage ( MixTime / MixDuration ) is less than the EventThreshold , event timelines are applied while this animation is being mixed out. Defaults to 0, so event timelines are not applied while this animation is being mixed out. Declaration public float EventThreshold { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source HoldPrevious If true, when mixing from the previous animation to this animation, the previous animation is applied as normal instead of being mixed out. When mixing between animations that key the same property, if a lower track also keys that property then the value will briefly dip toward the lower track value during the mix. This happens because the first animation mixes from 100% to 0% while the second animation mixes from 0% to 100%. Setting HoldPrevious to true applies the first animation at 100% during the mix so the lower track value is overwritten. Such dipping does not occur on the lowest track which keys the property, only when a higher track also keys the property. Snapping will occur if HoldPrevious is true and this animation does not key all the same properties as the previous animation. Declaration public bool HoldPrevious { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean | Improve this Doc View Source IsComplete Returns true if at least one loop has been completed. Declaration public bool IsComplete { get; } Property Value Type Description Boolean See Also Complete | Improve this Doc View Source Loop If true, the animation will repeat. If false it will not, instead its last frame is applied if played beyond its duration. Declaration public bool Loop { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean | Improve this Doc View Source MixBlend Controls how properties keyed in the animation are mixed with lower tracks. Defaults to Replace , which replaces the values from the lower tracks with the animation values. Add adds the animation values to the values from the lower tracks. The MixBlend can be set for a new track entry only before Apply(Skeleton) is first called. Declaration public MixBlend MixBlend { get; set; } Property Value Type Description MixBlend | Improve this Doc View Source MixDuration Seconds for mixing from the previous animation to this animation. Defaults to the value provided by AnimationStateData GetMix(Animation, Animation) based on the animation before this animation (if any). The MixDuration can be set manually rather than use the value from GetMix(Animation, Animation) . In that case, the MixDuration can be set for a new track entry only before Update(Single) is first called. When using AddAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean, Single) with a Delay <= 0, note the Delay is set using the mix duration from the AnimationStateData , not a mix duration set afterward. Declaration public float MixDuration { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source MixingFrom The track entry for the previous animation when mixing from the previous animation to this animation, or null if no mixing is currently occuring. When mixing from multiple animations, MixingFrom makes up a linked list. Declaration public TrackEntry MixingFrom { get; } Property Value Type Description TrackEntry | Improve this Doc View Source MixingTo The track entry for the next animation when mixing from this animation to the next animation, or null if no mixing is currently occuring. When mixing to multiple animations, MixingTo makes up a linked list. Declaration public TrackEntry MixingTo { get; } Property Value Type Description TrackEntry | Improve this Doc View Source MixTime Seconds from 0 to the MixDuration when mixing from the previous animation to this animation. May be slightly more than MixDuration when the mix is complete. Declaration public float MixTime { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source Next The animation queued to start after this animation, or null. Next makes up a linked list. Declaration public TrackEntry Next { get; } Property Value Type Description TrackEntry | Improve this Doc View Source TimeScale Declaration public float TimeScale { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source TrackEnd The track time in seconds when this animation will be removed from the track. Defaults to the highest possible float value, meaning the animation will be applied until a new animation is set or the track is cleared. If the track end time is reached, no other animations are queued for playback, and mixing from any previous animations is complete, then the properties keyed by the animation are set to the setup pose and the track is cleared. It may be desired to use AddEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single, Single) rather than have the animation abruptly cease being applied. Declaration public float TrackEnd { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source TrackIndex The index of the track where this entry is either current or queued. Declaration public int TrackIndex { get; } Property Value Type Description Int32 See Also GetCurrent(Int32) | Improve this Doc View Source TrackTime Current time in seconds this track entry has been the current track entry. The track time determines AnimationTime . The track time can be set to start the animation at a time other than 0, without affecting looping. Declaration public float TrackTime { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single Methods | Improve this Doc View Source Reset() Declaration public void Reset() | Improve this Doc View Source ResetRotationDirections() Resets the rotation directions for mixing this entry's rotate timelines. This can be useful to avoid bones rotating the long way around when using Spine.TrackEntry.alpha and starting animations on other tracks. Mixing with Replace involves finding a rotation between two others, which has two possible solutions: the short way or the long way around. The two rotations likely change over time, so which direction is the short or long way also changes. If the short way was always chosen, bones would flip to the other side when that direction became the long way. TrackEntry chooses the short way the first time it is applied and remembers that direction. Declaration public void ResetRotationDirections() | Improve this Doc View Source ToString() Declaration public override string ToString() Returns Type Description String Overrides Object.ToString() Events | Improve this Doc View Source Complete Declaration public event AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate Complete Event Type Type Description AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate | Improve this Doc View Source Dispose Declaration public event AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate Dispose Event Type Type Description AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate | Improve this Doc View Source End Declaration public event AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate End Event Type Type Description AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate | Improve this Doc View Source Event Declaration public event AnimationState.TrackEntryEventDelegate Event Event Type Type Description AnimationState.TrackEntryEventDelegate | Improve this Doc View Source Interrupt Declaration public event AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate Interrupt Event Type Type Description AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate | Improve this Doc View Source Start Declaration public event AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate Start Event Type Type Description AnimationState.TrackEntryDelegate Implements Pool<T>.IPoolable Extension Methods SkeletonExtensions.AllowImmediateQueue(TrackEntry)

api/Spine.Collections.OrderedDictionary-.title: Class OrderedDictionary<TKey, TValue> | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.Collections.OrderedDictionary-.keywords: Class OrderedDictionary<TKey, TValue> Represents a dictionary that tracks the order that items were added. Inheritance Object OrderedDictionary<TKey, TValue> Implements IDictionary <TKey, TValue> IList < KeyValuePair <TKey, TValue>> ICollection < KeyValuePair <TKey, TValue>> IEnumerable < KeyValuePair <TKey, TValue>> IEnumerable Inherited Members Object.Equals(Object) Object.Equals(Object, Object) Object.GetHashCode() Object.GetType() Object.MemberwiseClone() Object.ReferenceEquals(Object, Object) Object.ToString() Namespace : Spine.Collections Assembly : spine-unity.dll Syntax public sealed class OrderedDictionary<TKey, TValue> : IDictionary<TKey, TValue>, IList<KeyValuePair<TKey, TValue>>, ICollection<KeyValuePair<TKey, TValue>>, IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<TKey, TValue>>, IEnumerable Type Parameters Name Description TKey The type of the dictionary keys. TValue The type of the dictionary values. Remarks This dictionary makes it possible to get the index of a key and a key based on an index. It can be costly to find the index of a key because it must be searched for linearly. It can be costly to insert a key/value pair because other key's indexes must be adjusted. It can be costly to remove a key/value pair because other keys' indexes must be adjusted. IHasSkeletonDataAsset, ISkeletonAnimation, IAnimationStateComponent Fields | Improve this Doc View Source loop Whether or not AnimationName should loop. This only applies to the initial animation specified in the inspector, or any subsequent Animations played through .AnimationName. Animations set through state.SetAnimation are unaffected. Declaration public bool loop Field Value Type Description Boolean | Improve this Doc View Source state This is the Spine.AnimationState object of this SkeletonAnimation. You can control animations through it. Note that this object, like .skeleton, is not guaranteed to exist in Awake. Do all accesses and caching to it in Start Declaration public AnimationState state Field Value Type Description AnimationState | Improve this Doc View Source timeScale The rate at which animations progress over time. 1 means 100%. 0.5 means 50%. Declaration public float timeScale Field Value Type Description Single Remarks AnimationState and TrackEntry also have their own timeScale. These are combined multiplicatively. Properties | Improve this Doc View Source AnimationName Setting this property sets the animation of the skeleton. If invalid, it will store the animation name for the next time the skeleton is properly initialized. Getting this property gets the name of the currently playing animation. If invalid, it will return the last stored animation name set through this property. api/Spine.IkConstraint.html.title: Class IkConstraint | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.IkConstraint.html.keywords: Class IkConstraint Stores the current pose for an IK constraint. An IK constraint adjusts the rotation of 1 or 2 constrained bones so the tip of the last bone is as close to the target bone as possible. See IK constraints in the Spine User Guide. Inheritance Object IkConstraint Implements IUpdatable Inherited Members Object.Equals(Object) Object.Equals(Object, Object) Object.GetHashCode() Object.GetType() Object.MemberwiseClone() Object.ReferenceEquals(Object, Object) Namespace : Spine Assembly : spine-unity.dll Syntax public class IkConstraint : IUpdatable Constructors | Improve this Doc View Source IkConstraint(IkConstraint, Skeleton) Copy constructor. Declaration public int BendDirection { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Int32 | Improve this Doc View Source Bones The bones that will be modified by this IK constraint. Declaration public ExposedList<Bone> Bones { get; } Property Value Type Description ExposedList < Bone > | Improve this Doc View Source Compress When true and only a single bone is being constrained, if the target is too close, the bone is scaled to reach it. Declaration public bool Compress { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean | Improve this Doc View Source Data The IK constraint's setup pose data. Declaration public IkConstraintData Data { get; } Property Value Type Description IkConstraintData | Improve this Doc View Source Mix A percentage (0-1) that controls the mix between the constrained and unconstrained rotations. Declaration public float Mix { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source Softness For two bone IK, the distance from the maximum reach of the bones that rotation will slow. Declaration public float Softness { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Single | Improve this Doc View Source Stretch When true, if the target is out of range, the parent bone is scaled to reach it. If more than one bone is being constrained and the parent bone has local nonuniform scale, stretch is not applied. Declaration public bool Stretch { get; set; } Property Value Type Description Boolean | Improve this Doc View Source Target The bone that is the IK target. Declaration public void SetBonesToSetupPose() | Improve this Doc View Source SetSkin(Skin) Sets the skin used to look up attachments before looking in the DefaultSkin . If the skin is changed, UpdateCache() is called. Attachments from the new skin are attached if the corresponding attachment from the old skin was attached. If there was no old skin, each slot's setup mode attachment is attached from the new skin. After changing the skin, the visible attachments can be reset to those attached in the setup pose by calling SetSlotsToSetupPose() . Also, often Apply(Skeleton) is called before the next time the skeleton is rendered to allow any attachment keys in the current animation(s) to hide or show attachments from the new skin. api/Spine.MixBlend.html.title: Enum MixBlend | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.MixBlend.html.keywords: Enum MixBlend Controls how a timeline is mixed with the setup or current pose. Namespace : Spine Assembly : spine-unity.dll Syntax public enum MixBlend Fields Name Description Add Transitions from the current value to the current value plus the timeline value. No change is made before the first key (the current value is kept until the first key). Add is intended for animations layered on top of others, not for the first animations applied. First Transitions from the current value to the timeline value. Before the first key, transitions from the current value to the setup value. Timelines which perform instant transitions, such as DrawOrderTimeline or AttachmentTimeline , use the setup value before the first key. First is intended for the first animations applied, not for animations layered on top of those. Replace Transitions from the current value to the timeline value. No change is made before the first key (the current value is kept until the first key). Replace is intended for animations layered on top of others, not for the first animations applied. Setup Transitions from the setup value to the timeline value (the current value is not used). Before the first key, the setup value is set.

api/Spine.Unity.html.title: Namespace Spine.Unity | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.Unity.html.keywords: Namespace Spine.Unity Classes AnimationReferenceAsset AtlasAssetBase BlendModeMaterialsAsset BoneFollower Sets a GameObject's transform to match a bone on a Spine skeleton. BoneFollowerGraphic BoundingBoxFollower DoubleBuffered<T> EventDataReferenceAsset MaterialsTextureLoader MeshGenerator Holds several methods to prepare and generate a UnityEngine mesh based on a skeleton. Contains buffers needed to perform the operation, and serializes settings for mesh generation. MeshRendererBuffers A double-buffered Mesh, and a shared material array, bundled for use by Spine components that need to push a Mesh and materials to a Unity MeshRenderer and MeshFilter. MeshRendererBuffers.SmartMesh This is a Mesh that also stores the instructions SkeletonRenderer generated for it. PointFollower RegionlessAttachmentLoader SkeletonAnimation SkeletonAnimationFixedTimestep SkeletonAnimationMulti SkeletonDataAsset SkeletonDataCompatibility SkeletonDataCompatibility.CompatibilityProblemInfo SkeletonDataCompatibility.VersionInfo SkeletonDataModifierAsset Can be stored by SkeletonDataAsset to automatically apply modifications to loaded SkeletonData. SkeletonExtensions SkeletonGraphic SkeletonMecanim SkeletonMecanim.MecanimTranslator SkeletonMecanim.MecanimTranslator.ClipInfos SkeletonPartsRenderer SkeletonRenderer Base class of animated Spine skeleton components. This component manages and renders a skeleton. SkeletonRendererCustomMaterials SkeletonRendererInstruction Instructions used by a SkeletonRenderer to render a mesh. SkeletonRenderSeparator SkeletonUtility SkeletonUtilityBone Sets a GameObject's transform to match a bone on a Spine skeleton. SkeletonUtilityConstraint SpineAnimation SpineAtlasAsset Loads and stores a Spine atlas and list of materials. SpineAtlasRegion SpineAttachment SpineAttributeBase SpineBone SpineEvent SpineIkConstraint SpineMesh SpinePathConstraint SpineSkin SpineSlot SpineTransformConstraint WaitForSpineAnimation Use this as a condition-blocking yield instruction for Unity Coroutines. The routine will pause until the AnimationState.TrackEntry fires any of the configured events. See the Spine Unity Events documentation page and for more information on when track events will be triggered. WaitForSpineAnimationComplete Use this as a condition-blocking yield instruction for Unity Coroutines. The routine will pause until the AnimationState.TrackEntry fires its Complete event. It can be configured to trigger on the End event as well to cover interruption. See the Spine Unity Events documentation page and for more information on when track events will be triggered. WaitForSpineAnimationEnd Use this as a condition-blocking yield instruction for Unity Coroutines. The routine will pause until the AnimationState.TrackEntry fires its End event. See the Spine Unity Events documentation page and for more information on when track events will be triggered. WaitForSpineEvent Use this as a condition-blocking yield instruction for Unity Coroutines. The routine will pause until the AnimationState fires an event matching the given event name or EventData reference. WaitForSpineTrackEntryEnd Use this as a condition-blocking yield instruction for Unity Coroutines. The routine will pause until the AnimationState.TrackEntry fires its End event. Structs MeshGenerator.Settings MeshGeneratorBuffers SkeletonRendererCustomMaterials.AtlasMaterialOverride SkeletonRendererCustomMaterials.SlotMaterialOverride SpineAttachment.Hierarchy A struct that represents 3 strings that help identify and locate an attachment in a skeleton. SubmeshInstruction Instructions for how to generate a mesh or submesh: "Render this skeleton's slots: start slot, up to but not including endSlot, using this material." Interfaces IAnimationStateComponent A Spine-Unity Component that uses a Spine.AnimationState to animate its skeleton. IHasSkeletonComponent A Spine-Unity Component that holds a reference to an ISkeletonComponent. IHasSkeletonDataAsset Holds a reference to a SkeletonDataAsset. IHasSkeletonRenderer A Spine-Unity Component that holds a reference to a SkeletonRenderer. ISkeletonAnimation A Spine-Unity Component that animates a Skeleton but not necessarily with a Spine.AnimationState. ISkeletonComponent A Spine-Unity Component that manages a Spine.Skeleton instance, instantiated from a SkeletonDataAsset. Use the firstIsSegment and secondIsSegment parameters to set whether the intersection point must be on the first and second line segments. Setting these both to true means you are doing a line-segment to line-segment intersection. Setting one of them to true means you are doing a line to line-segment intersection test, and so on. Note: If two line segments are coincident, then no intersection is detected (there are actually infinite intersection points). Declaration public static bool LinesIntersect2D(Point2D ptStart0, Point2D ptEnd0, Point2D ptStart1, Point2D ptEnd1, bool firstIsSegment, bool secondIsSegment, bool coincidentEndPointCollisions, ref Point2D pIntersectionPt, double epsilon) Parameters Type Name Description Point2D ptStart0 The first point of the first line segment. Point2D ptEnd0 The second point of the first line segment. Point2D ptStart1 The first point of the second line segment. Point2D ptEnd1 The second point of the second line segment. Boolean firstIsSegment Set this to true to require that the intersection point be on the first line segment. Boolean secondIsSegment Set this to true to require that the intersection point be on the second line segment. Boolean coincidentEndPointCollisions Set this to true to enable collisions if the line segments share an endpoint Point2D pIntersectionPt This is set to the intersection point if an intersection is detected. Description Boolean | Improve this Doc View Source PolygonContainsPolygon(IList<Point2D>, Rect2D, IList<Point2D>, Rect2D, Boolean) Checks to see if poly1 contains poly2. return true if so, false otherwise. If the polygons intersect, then poly1 cannot contain poly2 (or vice-versa for that matter) Since the poly intersection test can be somewhat expensive, we'll only run it if the user requests it. If runIntersectionTest is false, then it is assumed that the user has already verified that the polygons do not intersect. If the polygons DO intersect and runIntersectionTest is false, then the return value is meaningless. Caveat emptor. As an added bonus, just to cause more user-carnage, if runIntersectionTest is false, then the boundRects are not used and can safely be passed in as nulls. However, if runIntersectionTest is true and you pass nulls for boundRect1 or boundRect2, you will cause a program crash. Finally, the polygon points are assumed to be passed in Clockwise winding order. It is possible that CounterClockwise ordering would work, but I have not verified the behavior in that case. Declaration public static bool PolygonContainsPolygon(IList<Point2D> poly1, Rect2D boundRect1, IList<Point2D> poly2, Rect2D boundRect2, bool runIntersectionTest) Parameters Type Name Description IList < Point2D > poly1 points of polygon1 Rect2D boundRect1 bounding rect of polygon1. Only used if runIntersectionTest is true IList < Point2D > poly2 points of polygon2 Rect2D boundRect2 bounding rect of polygon2. Method: Start at vertex with minimum y (pick maximum x one if there are two). We aim our "lastDir" vector at (1.0, 0) We look at the two rays going off from our start vertex, and follow whichever has the smallest angle (in -Pi . Pi) wrt lastDir ("rightest" turn) Loop until we hit starting vertex: We add our current vertex to the list. We check the seg from current vertex to next vertex for intersections if no intersections, follow to next vertex and continue if intersections, pick one with minimum distance if more than one, pick one with "rightest" next point (two possibilities for each) Declaration public static List<Point2DList> SplitComplexPolygon(Point2DList verts, double epsilon) Parameters Type Name Description Point2DList verts Double epsilon Returns Type Description List < Point2DList >

api/Spine.Unity.Editor.html.keywords: Namespace Spine.Unity.Editor Classes AnimationReferenceAssetEditor AssetDatabaseAvailabilityDetector AssetUtility AssetUtility.AtlasRequirementLoader BoneFollowerGraphicInspector BoneFollowerInspector BoundingBoxFollowerInspector EditorInstantiation EditorInstantiation.SkeletonComponentSpawnType Menus PointFollowerInspector SkeletonAnimationInspector SkeletonBaker [SUPPORTS] Linear, Constant, and Bezier Curves* Inverse Kinematics* Inherit Rotation Translate Timeline Rotate Timeline Scale Timeline** Event Timeline*** Attachment Timeline RegionAttachment MeshAttachment (optionally Skinned) [LIMITATIONS] *Bezier Curves are baked into the animation at 60fps and are not realtime. Use bakeIncrement constant to adjust key density if desired. *Inverse Kinematics is baked into the animation at 60fps and are not realtime. Use bakeIncrement constant to adjust key density if desired. ***Events may only fire 1 type of data per event in Unity safely so priority to String data if present in Spine key, otherwise a Float is sent whether the Spine key was Int or Float with priority given to Int. Slots organize attachments for {@link Skeleton#drawOrder} purposes and provide a place to store state for an attachment.State cannot be stored in an attachment itself because attachments are stateless and may be shared across multiple skeletons. api/Mobge.ReusableCache.html.title: Class ReusableCache | Example Unity documentation
api/Mobge.ReusableCache.html.keywords: Class ReusableCache This class act as a context for instantiated items. It efficiently keeps track of the instantiated items and pools them when they finish their purpose. When you destroy this class it removes all the pools that are created for items. See PushCache(ReusableCache) and ControlledPopCache(ReusableCache) . api/Spine.TransformConstraint.html.title: Class TransformConstraint | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.TransformConstraint.html.keywords: Class TransformConstraint Stores the current pose for a transform constraint. A transform constraint adjusts the world transform of the constrained bones to match that of the target bone. See Transform constraints in the Spine User Guide. api/Spine.Bone.html.title: Class Bone | Example Unity documentation
api/Spine.Bone.html.keywords: Class Bone Stores a bone's current pose. A bone has a local transform which is used to compute its world transform. A bone also has an applied transform, which is a local transform that can be applied to compute the world transform. The local transform and applied transform may differ if a constraint or application code modifies the world transform after it was computed from the local transform. Smart popup menu for Spine Events (Spine.PathConstraint) Declaration public SpinePathConstraint(string startsWith = "", string dataField = "", bool includeNone = true, bool fallbackToTextField = false) Parameters Type Name Description String startsWith Filters popup results to elements that begin with supplied string. String dataField If specified, a locally scoped field with the name supplied by in dataField will be used to fill the popup results. Valid types are SkeletonDataAsset and SkeletonRenderer (and derivatives). If left empty and the script the attribute is applied to is derived from Component, GetComponent(SkeletonRenderer)() will be called as a fallback. Boolean includeNone If true, the dropdown list will include a "none" option which stored as an empty string. Boolean fallbackToTextField

api/Spine.PathConstraint.html.keywords: Class PathConstraint Stores the current pose for a path constraint. A path constraint adjusts the rotation, translation, and scale of the constrained bones so they follow a {@link PathAttachment}. See Path constraints in the Spine User Guide.
